lead_paragraph: When a New Jersey police officer was mistakenly accused of political activity and demoted, he was still protected by the First Amendment, the Supreme Court decided.

headline.print_headline: Justices Rule for Officer  Demoted in New Jersey
headline.main: Justices Rule First Amendment Protects Officer Demoted in Misunderstanding

snippet: When a New Jersey police officer was mistakenly accused of political activity and demoted, he was still protected by the First Amendment, the Supreme Court decided.
abstract: Supreme Court rules unconstitutional demotion of Paterson, NJ, Police Officer Jeffrey J Heffernan, based on supervisor's mistaken belief that he was engaging in political activity because he was seen carrying campaign sign for mayoral candidate; majority ruling states that Heffernan's First Amendment rights were violated, regardless of why he was carrying campaign material.
